newsitem.title: USA: ATHLETICS-THREE FINALISTS NAMED FOR TOP U.S. TRACK POSITION.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-THREE FINALISTS NAMED FOR TOP U.S. TRACK POSITION.

text.p: Former international miler Craig Masback and two other men have been selected as finalists for the executive directorship of USA Track & Field, the national governing body announced on Wednesday.

Masback, now a television commentator and a Washington-based attorney; Thomas Chestnut, a former executive vice president of the NBA's Philadelphia 76ers; and Robert C. Vowels Jr, an assistant commissioner of the Big Ten Conference, will be interviewed by USATF's executive committee in San Francisco on May 31, USATF president Pat Rico said.
The three were recommended by a search committee that met last weekend in San Francisco.

The organisation is seeking a replacement for Ollan Cassell, U.S. athletics' top official since 1965. USATF board of directors, unhappy with Cassell's leadership, voted in December not to renew his contract when it expires in March 1998.
